title: Electrolyte tuning with low concentrations of additive for dendrite suppression in lithium metal anodes
content:
Sustainable Energy Fuels, 2024, 8,3574-3582
DOI: 10.1039/D4SE00548A, Communication
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Abiral Baniya, Madan Bahadur Saud, Hansheng Li, M. Bilal Faheem, Yuchen Zhang, Ashok Thapa, Raja Sekhar Bobba, Poojan Indrajeet Kaswekar, Quinn Qiao
Lithium metal is considered as an ideal anode for high-energy density storage systems with dendrites being a major issue for lifetime and safety. A gadolinium additive is found to be suppressing dendrite growth resulting higher performance retention.
